subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=38|rad=女|as=07|sn=10|four=43432|canj=VIAV|ids=⿰女良}}

subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms|t2=孃|note={{lang|zh|孃}}: “mother”}}

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|女|良|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Not attested in pre-[[Tang]] texts. It may ultimately have been a fusion of {{ltc-l|女郎|lady|id=1,1}} ({{zh-ref|Coblin, 1994}}).

Alternatively, it may be a loan from {{cog|trk-pro|[[*ana]] ~ [[*eńe]]||mother}}; compare {{cog|tr|ana}} and {{cog|ug|ئانا}} ({{zh-ref|Vovin and McCraw, 2011}}).

|kun=むすめ-, こ-}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むすめ}}
Compound of {{com|ja|sort=むすめ|生す|tr1=musu|t1=to beget|女|tr2=me|t2=female}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR"></ref>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|y=k|むすめ|acc=3|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}
